page.title: 03BOWNESS-ON-SOLWAY.SERVICES 2
page.content: Families will spend a whole day on the Estuary. Tourists and some locals are often sceptical about 1)The warning signs for flooded roads...cars often get marooned and 2) the warnings about the strong currents and unstable sands...there have been several drownings in recent years. Unfortunately, on a fine day, the estuary looks very inviting. Footpaths in the area are Burn's Lonning, The King's Arms to Shore via iron ladder, and The Banks-a medieval rampart on the highest part of the village. The Banks gives views of Scotland and marvellous sunsets.
